page.title: 14Health in Alburgh
page.content: {HEALTH Ambulancies take emergencies to the Norfolk and Norwich hospital in Norwich.Hospital cars can be arraged for other appointments for those with out private transport. The general practitioners in Bungay and Harleston visit Alburgh and Redenhall. Surgeries are held twice daily.The village people run a rota for the collection of prescriptions for the housebound. The district nurses visits homes to give treatment regularly where necessary.There is also a health visitor who liases between doctors and patients, and visits homes especially to give ante and post natal to help the elderly. She runs the baby clinic in the next villages of Denton and at Harleston which the mothers from the district atend with there children.
